item.title: ElasticSearch+Redis for general text search
item.description: What is Elastic-Search Elasticsearch is document oriented, meaning that it stores entire objects or documents. It not only stores them, but also indexes the contents of each document in order to make them searchable. In Elasticsearch, you index, search, sort, and filter documents—​not rows of columnar data. This is a fundamentally different way of thinking about data and is one of the reasons Elasticsearch can perform complex full-text search. The act of storing data in Elasticsearch is called indexing.

item.title: Java Apache Kafak Study
item.description: Fundamental Kafka Theory =>:send to data sources =>topics => partition => offsets data is randomly sent to the partition unless the key is provided brokers and topics kafka cluster is composed of multiple brokers(servers) broker contains topics' partitions connect to any broker, then connect to whole cluster topics replication if one broker is down, another broker can serve the data. one broker can be leader for a given partition.

item.title: Be Payment Ready
item.description: overall learning First of all, really appreciate the firm gave me the opportunity learning and working during the pandemic.
